Shovon Rahman: Hobbyist Programmer and Musician

I am a hobbyist programmer, and I also happen to make music during my spare time. I do a lot of coding using JavaScript, CoffeeScript, C#, and PHP. And when I'm producing music, I use LMMS.

Coding Work

Node Chat

I have never worked on a cloud platform before until I had the urge to build my very own chat app. I decided to use Node.js and host it on Heroku. Check it out.

Button Generator

Need to come up with a button in CSS? Here's something that will allow you to visually create a button, without having to deal with any coding. Once you're happy with your design, you can grab the CSS and use it on your own design.

Math Editor

I worked on this project because I was inspired by math.stackexhange.com's ability to display beautifully formatted math equations to you as you typed the LaTeX code. Give it a try.

Twitter Search

This is what I built while I was exploring the Twitter API. This app is a simple little twitter search tool. Go check out what people are talking about.

Past Work

TEDxYouth@Vancouver

An educator and a district principal wanted youths to host a TEDx event for TEDxYouthDay in Vancouver. They needed a website. So I came up with a design giving it a youth-like look and feel. Because they needed a platform to blog on, I used WordPress as the CMS.

ArtQuake

ArtQuake is an art and music event held in the greater Vancouver area. They needed a small website to outline what the organization is all about, while reflecting on its values and beliefs through the use of textures and images.
